description: A bunch of strong magnets encased in plastic.  Can be worn on webbing.  Intended for breachers to stash their shotguns away on a mission.

variants.description: A Kydex body holding four strong magnets inside.  MSRS stands for "magnetic shotgun retention system", as it was originally designed to securely hold breaching shotguns.  The "holster" can, of course, hold any weapon made of a ferromagnetic material.  <variant_olive>

A Kydex body holding four strong magnets inside.  MSRS stands for "magnetic shotgun retention system", as it was originally designed to securely hold breaching shotguns.  The "holster" can, of course, hold any weapon made of a ferromagnetic material.  <variant_olive>

//weight: very-roughly estimated from assumed weights of constituent parts
Kydex has the density of only 1.35 g/mL, making it lightweight, and there isn't that much of it, so if we assume ~40 mL of Kydex across the entirety of the holster, it amounts to 54 g

notes: length and width are assumed from visual reference, based on the Molle-Lok attachment's dimensions
trim presumes the uneven parts eventually even out with the overall shape

//material: iron is for neodymium, the presumed material for the magnets
the magnet in DDA is made from cast iron, whereas its actual material is stated to be alnico, an iron alloy

description: A nylon MOLLE pouch for collapsible batons.  Can hold most models of batons available on the market.  Typically worn by police officers who use webbing duty belts.

name.str: Blue Force Gear MOLLE baton pouch
name.str_pl: Blue Force Gear MOLLE baton pouches

variants.description: A thin nylon MOLLE pouch for collapsible batons.  Can hold most models of batons available on the market. Typically worn by police officers who use webbing duty belts.  <variant_multicam>

//longest_side: width, since we assume that the pouch would fold length-wise

pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: 50% over the weight of audited `baton` in order to accomodate heavier batons

//notes: while the source of dimensions is not close to the model, we use it because finding dimensions of the model item online has proven to be difficult
could this be a good location for carabiner-held gear?
description: A metal ring on a strap which attaches to the belt.  Can hold a PR-24 baton or a regular-sized flashlight.

variants.description: A metal ring with a tongue, held by a thin nylon strap.  Usually worn on the belt by an on-duty police officer, and holds the Monadnock PR-24 side-handle baton.  Can also hold standard-sized flashlight, though not smaller or larger ones.  <variant_black>

//longest_side: width, since we assume that while the strap could fold any way, the ring cannot
//flags: we add PALS_SMALL because it seems perfectly possible for this ring to strap to PALS webbing

description: A nylon pouch for stun guns.  Can fit a variety of models.

variants.description: A nylon pouch for stun guns.  Fit for a specific model, but can fit similar models.  <variant_grey>

//volume: appears to be ~5% larger than the bounding box (raw volume) of the stun gun, so that's what we use
//longest_side: longest side of stun gun (165 mm) + 5%
//flags: while it's not immediately clear whether the pouch can be used with PALS webbing, we assume that it can be for the sake of our sanity
//price: sold alongside the stun gun, so no way to estimate a real price

description: An arrangement of nylon straps locked together with a plastic buckle.  Can hold a medium- or large-sized breaching tool.  Straps to webbing, so could be carried on a plate carrier or a belt.

variants.description: A couple of tough nylon straps locked together with a plastic buckle.  Can hold a single breaching tool.  Straps to PALS webbing on your plate carrier, rig, or belt.  <variant_multicam>
